column4: I have Ubuntu 5.10, and I have a printer on my network tat has a built in print server with a static IP.  From a windows xp machine, I connect to it either by the share name on a server, or I can just create an LPR port to the printer's ip address.  In ubuntu can I do that?  Can I just conecct through an LPR or TCP port so as to avoid SAMBA?
if it's through an Apple Airport, try port 9101
if using the Printer setup admin tool in Ubuntu, specify it's a "JetDirect" printer
